Issues.Title: [release/8.0] Fix issue 9999: Update IconEditor to offset the icon within the property grid entry
Issues.Body:
Backport of #10131 to release/8.0

## Customer Impact
- The icon property of the NotifyIcon control can be modified

## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

The icon property of the NotifyIcon control cannot be modified

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/dab536e8-e545-4370-a641-0008ba2bc5a8

### After
The icon property of the NotifyIcon control can be modified

![AfterChange](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/c89cdc0c-5283-4395-82d5-f22daf31e02e)


## Testing
- Manually (Verified in Demo project)

## Risk
- Minimal

Issues.Title: 'Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found' crash occurs when trying to add Items in ImageCollection Editor in .NET Core project
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.6.2

### .NET version

Net 7.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No

### Issue description

When attempting to add an item as an image in the ImageCollection Editor through the Properties window in the .NET Core project, a 'Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found' crash occurs. However, this issue is not present in the .NET Framework project. Is there any way to resolve this.


![ImageCollectionEdit](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/155132856/044cc360-ad09-4520-bf18-642d0bef240f)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the sample.
2. Add the ImageListExt Control (UserControl) from the Toolbox to the Form.
3. On the Form designer page, right-click on the control to open the properties window.
4. Click on the MyItems ImageCollection property to edit the ImageCollection.
5. Then, click on the "Add" button to add an item to the "Image Collection Editor."
6. Note that the "Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found" crash will occur when attempting to add the item in the "Image Collection Editor."


[ImageListExt-NetCoreIssue](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13791240/ImageListExt-NetCoreIssue.zip)


### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'Constructor on type 'System.Drawing.Image' not found' crash occurs when trying to add Items in ImageCollection Editor in .NET Core project" (#10549)

Issues.Title: ImageFormat.Webp always reverts to the png codec.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0, or any other version.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

.NET 8.0 added ImageFormat.Webp but there is no such codec in GDI+. It always reverts to using the png codec.

### Steps to reproduce

bitmap1.Save("test.webp", ImageForma.Webp);
//or
ImageCodecInfo.GetImageEncoders(); // no webp encoder exists.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ImageFormat.Webp always reverts to the png codec." (#10559)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Stabilize ImageList_FinalizerReleasesNativeHandle_ReturnsExpected" (#10555)

Issues.Title: Only upload test results when tests run
Issues.Body:
Avoids a warning in CI that occurs when attempting to upload test results and none exist.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10553)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Only upload test results when tests run" (#10553)

Issues.Title: Enable the xUnit1004 refactoring
Issues.Body:
xUnit1004 comes with a code fix that allows users to remove the `Skip` attribute from a test method using the light bulb. This code fix only works when the diagnostic is enabled. This pull request enables the diagnostic at `silent` severity, which means it applies to the IDE experience but still does not report any diagnostics during a build.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10554)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable the xUnit1004 refactoring" (#10554)

Issues.Title: Implement screen recording for integration tests
Issues.Body:
Record the screen during integration tests, and save an animated PNG (*.apng) if the test fails. Derived from a similar implementation in dotnet/roslyn.

Integration tests will be re-enabled for CI as a follow-up to this.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10552)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Implement screen recording for integration tests" (#10552)

Issues.Title: The "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox have wrong Control in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-alpha.1.23621.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, the MaskedTextBox start support from 9.0

### Issue description

The "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox have incorrect ControlType - LIst instead of Table

### Steps to reproduce

1. Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
2. Open the inspect tool to observe the ControlType of the "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox 

**Actually Results:**
The "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox have incorrect ControlType
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/71e382aa-51f2-45a3-a9b7-9e82e6fbf74e)

**Expected Results:**
The "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox have correct ControlType
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/ba735897-4f64-4257-9858-665bca9bb482)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The "Input Mask" dialog for MaskedTextBox have wrong Control in the DemoConsole application" (#10546)

Issues.Title: No text for new tabpage item that added by TabPages property in the properties window in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-alpha.1.23621.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

The issue also can reproduce .NET 8.0, which start support the TabControl.

### Issue description

No text for new tabpage item added by TabPages property in the properties window in the DemoConsole application

### Steps to reproduce

1. Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
2. Add new tabpage item by TabPages property in the properties window 

**Actually Results:**
No text for new tabpage item added by TabPages property in the properties window
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/fff07432-f8f3-4b82-a2a4-6ea5f77b8a77)
![TabControl](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/e1788125-2832-45b1-8148-1640a410b094)

**Expected Results:**
Have text for new tabpage item added by TabPages property in the properties window

**More info:**
The issue can't reproduce when added new tabpage item by using Command/SmartTag
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No text for new tabpage item that added by TabPages property in the properties window in the DemoConsole application" (#10545)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-alpha.1.23621.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox

### Issue description

[Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open and run the attached reproduce application
[ScrollBarTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13782718/ScrollBarTest.zip)
2. Launch Inspect or Accessibility Insight tool
3. Focus on the entire cotnrol

**Actual result:**
1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/5a6b8c79-ce62-418c-a953-718e156e5e4d)
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/80b9973c-21a2-4ab5-bdd4-aafe5adf448b)
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/2f10ef12-224a-4613-bd46-3345bd379d95)

**Expected result:**
1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/3db13ec7-ee3c-44bf-9f4d-0e71d896116b)
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/2d0c015a-60ec-4ae7-a0bc-86160f85f191)
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/24c15fa2-d2f9-45d1-ac18-442b5380c3d4)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar" (#10540)

Issues.Title: Cursor class does unnecessary finalization in some cases
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

unknown

### Issue description

Constructors for `Cursor` for the common case of system cursors should call `GC.SuppressFinalize(this)` so that the objects don't get unnecessarily queued for finalization.  This is currently what happens when a call is made to `Cursor.Current`.

pull request at
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10538

### Steps to reproduce

n/a
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cursor class does unnecessary finalization in some cases" (#10539)
